data.name: The Darkest Files
data.detailed_description:
The Darkest Files is a historical investigation and court room game based on true crimes of the Nazi era.

Nothing belongs to the past, everything is still present and can become the future again.

World War 2 has ended. Yet Nazis can still be found in high ranking positions all across Germany. Hesse's Attorney General Fritz Bauer establishes a special unit of young, unencumbered public prosecutors to pursue and investigate Nazi crimes and to prosecute the perpetrators.

Play through the untold true story of the Nazi hunter attorneys of the 1950s, in an engaging storyline interweaving personal and political history, in an unique mix of first-person gameplay and beautiful comic art style.

How the Darkest Files plays

You play as the young prosecutor Esther Katz, seek evidences in files and interrogate witnesses to solve the cold-cases from the Nazi era, by reconstructing the crime scene in your reconstruction board. Take your case to the court and bring the perpetrators to justice.

Investigate: Search files from the Nazi era for clues. Use your network to find witnesses.

Interrogate: Interview witnesses and suspects and confront them with their contradictions and lies.

Immerse Make the crimes visible and experience them first hand by imagining them in Esther's mind's eye.

Reconstruct: Reconstruct the crime details step by step, propose your version of the truth to build a case.

Charge: Find the correct charge, press charges, and have the accused arrested.

Convince: Convince the court, reveal the truth and bring the criminals against humanity to justice.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7 (SP+1)
  • Processor: x64
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX10 capable GPUs
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 3 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Anything

Minimum:
  • OS: High Sierra 10.13+
  • Processor: x64
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM

  • Sound Card: Anything

content_descriptors.notes: This Game may contain content not appropriate for all ages. Some scenes feature disturbing content in the form of narrative text or imagery and a sensitive general theme.
